triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: The core domain in which the paper evaluates fairness and biases in multiple NLP models.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The fundamental technique used to build the language models and NLP systems being evaluated.

triples.name: Fairness (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Central concept for assessing whether models treat all demographic groups equitably across tasks.

triples.name: Algorithmic bias
triples.relevance: The primary phenomenon being measured and analyzed in debiased and biased NLP models.

triples.name: Language model
triples.relevance: The key artifact being benchmarked for bias and fairness across downstream tasks.

triples.name: Gender bias
triples.relevance: A specific demographic dimension of bias explicitly examined in the intersectional bias assessment.

triples.name: Racial discrimination
triples.relevance: Another demographic dimension of bias explicitly examined alongside gender in the intersectional analysis.

triples.name: Intersectionality
triples.relevance: The core analytical framework for assessing how multiple demographic biases compound and interact.

triples.name: Debiasing
triples.relevance: The debiasing strategies evaluated in the paper to determine their effectiveness across downstream tasks.

triples.name: Benchmarking
triples.relevance: The novel methodology proposed for systematically evaluating fairness across multiple NLP models and tasks.
